ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] DONT DONT DONT
ygData.msgSnippet: I didn t really do anything special. I always had my drum equipped and rotated charm, selo s and put in a hymn when he got too close. With regular cyclopses if
ygData.messageBody:
I didn't really do anything special. I always had my drum equipped and
rotated charm, selo's and put in a hymn when he got too close.

With regular cyclopses if I was hurting I would equip the lute as I would
be fast enough to get away from them with selo's. But Tarskuk I would
definitely keep some good distance and use the drum.

I didn't have much lambent and about the only CHA enhancing item I had was
Mask of Deception. I'm guessing you may have tried at 27.

---Windleaf

At 04:55 PM 6/2/00 -0400, you wrote:
>Hmm maybe I tried it at 27... charm window is the 5-6 level hard limit for
>sticking spells without them being resisted 100% (after the early 30's it
>seems to start to widen)
>
>I'd love to know how you charmed him. He resisted every attempt for about
>20 tries when I was 27 or 28... it was a long time ago though so I could
>have been 27 and was just 1 level too low.
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "John Tatsukawa" <john@...>
>To: <eqbards@egroups.com>; <eqbards@egroups.com>
>Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 4:46 PM
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] DONT DONT DONT
>
>
> > I used Tarskuk a couple of times at level 28. I only died to him once and
> > that was because I was careless with keeping my Selo's up.
> >
> > I don't know what the "charm window" is, but it worked for me. I'm level
>32
> > now, so it wasn't all that long ago for me.
> >
> > ---Windleaf
> >
> > At 02:42 PM 6/2/00 -0400, Kevin L. Crawford wrote:
> > >DONT! Try to charm Tarskuk at level 28, he WILL eat you, he was red at
> > >level 30 (which means he's outside the charm window)
> > >
> > >I successfully charmed him at 33, however. He's the same level as HG's.
> > >
> > >Lyrnia Jongleur
> > >Bard of Norrath
> > >51 - Test, 42 - Saryrn
> > >
> > >----- Original Message -----
> > >From: "John Tatsukawa" <john@...>
> > >To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> > >Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 1:34 PM
> > >Subject: Re: [eqbards] Charming in the outdoors
> > >
> > >
> > > > You're really close to Rathe Mountain zone. Head there and charm
>cyclopses
> > > > to fight other clopses or giant skeletons. If you're really good with
> > > > charm/selo's you can charm Tarskuk and have him wipe everything out
>for
> > > > you. But he is faster than normal clops, so you might have to zone if
>you
> > > > get into trouble.
> > > >
> > > > ---Windleaf
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > At 10:33 AM 6/2/00 -0400, you wrote:
> > > > >Hail
> > > > >
> > > > > My bard is 28, and if I have to spend another day running
>around
> > > > >chickenville in SK looking for Harriers and Avocets during primetime
>I am
> > > > >going to go nuts. I enjoy the charming in the outdoors and made it
> > >through
> > > > >level 27 and half way in to 28 with out a scratch on me =). Does
>anyone
> > > > >know anything outdoors (especially static spawns) that is worth going
> > >after
> > > > >at this level using charm? The chickens were nice because the spawns
> > >were
> > > > >static in the village. I know there is Choon and Froon but they are
> > > > >usually camped. Though the centuar spawns in the stables are static
>I
> > > > >found it to be a bit risky.
> > > >
> > > >
